t: Ezekiel 42

Then*p he brought me forth into the utter court, the way toward the north: and he brought me into the chamber that was over against the separate place, and which was before the building toward the north.
Before*p the length of an hundred cubits was the north door, and the breadth was fifty cubits.
Over*p against the twenty cubits which were for the inner court, and over against the pavement which was for the utter court, was gallery against gallery in three stories.
And*p before the chambers was a walk of ten cubits breadth inward, a way of one cubit; and their doors toward the north.
Now*p the upper chambers were shorter: for the galleries were higher than these, than the lower, and than the middlemost of the building.
For*p they were in three stories, but had not pillars as the pillars of the courts: therefore the building was straitened more than the lowest and the middlemost from the ground.
And*p the wall that was without over against the chambers, toward the utter court on the forepart of the chambers, the length thereof was fifty cubits.
For*p the length of the chambers that were in the utter court was fifty cubits: and, lo, before the temple were an hundred cubits.
And*p from under these chambers was the entry on the east side, as one goeth into them from the utter court.
The*p chambers were in the thickness of the wall of the court toward the east, over against the separate place, and over against the building.

And*p the way before them was like the appearance of the chambers which were toward the north, as long as they, and as broad as they: and all their goings out were both according to their fashions, and according to their doors.
And*p according to the doors of the chambers that were toward the south was a door in the head of the way, even the way directly before the wall toward the east, as one entereth into them.

Then*p said he unto me, The north chambers and the south chambers, which are before the separate place, they be holy chambers, where the priests that approach unto the Lord*s shall eat the most holy things: there shall they lay the most holy things, and the meat offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; for the place is holy.

When*p the priests enter therein, then shall they not go out of the holy place into the utter court, but there they shall lay their garments wherein they minister; for they are holy; and shall put on other garments, and shall approach to those things which are for the people.
Now*p when he had made an end of measuring the inner house, he brought me forth toward the gate whose prospect is toward the east, and measured it round about.
He*p measured the east side with the measuring reed, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.
He*p measured the north side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed round about.
He*p measured the south side, five hundred reeds, with the measuring reed.
He*p turned about to the west side, and measured five hundred reeds with the measuring reed.
He*p measured it by the four sides: it had a wall round about, five hundred reeds long, and five hundred broad, to make a separation between the sanctuary and the profane place.
